column4: that will hide them in vim but leave them in the file I believe
vim tries to be smart. If it detects line endings in dos, it'll do it in dos, and likewise for unix.
But if you set the encoding, I'm 99% sure that it'll write it in that format.
In this case, there must've been a mixup somewhere, perhaps some configuration isn't quite right, or there is some confusion in the file (mixed line endings?)
